work_summary: S2A Phase 3 activation. Implemented Database Manager MCP server (safe SQLite queries). Added WordPress health check tool to validation-audit MCP. Fixed tag_analyzer.py bugs. Established coordinations with Agent-7 (Web Domain Index) and Agent-8 (SSOT tagging fixes). Validated Batch 1 tagging fixes at 100% success.
decisions_made: Database Manager MCP restricted to SQLite initially for safety (read-only defaults with write confirmation)
WordPress health check integrated into existing validation-audit MCP server architecture
Tag analyzer bug fixes maintain backward compatibility with existing reports
SSOT tagging coordination uses small batch approach (4 files per batch) for rapid iteration
tradeoffs: SQLite-only DB MCP avoids complex MySQL configuration overhead but limits immediate WordPress DB access
Read-only defaults in DB MCP prioritize data safety over operational speed
Batch-based SSOT tagging allows parallel work but requires multiple validation cycles

cold_start_handoff.current_state: Agent-5 active, Database Manager MCP and WordPress health check implemented, coordinations ongoing with Agent-7 and Agent-8
immediate_priorities: Monitor Agent-8's Batch 2 SSOT tagging fixes (4 tools assigned)
Scan web domain for index-to-FS alignment (Agent-7 coordination)
Resume Tier 1 analytics validation once Agent-3 completes GA4/Pixel ID configuration
blockers: GA4/Pixel ID configuration (Agent-3) blocks Tier 1 analytics validation
dependencies: Agent-8 Batch 2 commit hash for validation
Agent-7 deployment completion for index alignment

knowledge_persisted: Database query safety patterns: keyword-based validation and URI-mode read-only protection
Tag analyzer bug fix: scope error in list comprehensions (fixed NameError in score_distribution)
SSOT tagging coordination pattern: automated detection + manual remediation with batch validation
MCP server registration process: add to all_mcp_servers.json and implement tool definitions
next_focus: Continue SSOT tagging validation cycles and prepare for analytics validation resumption
